page.title: 02HOUSING IN THE AREA
page.content:
Other than a dozen dwelling houses there is no housing developement except for the conversion of old estate buildings to dwellings and the erection of two houses on the site of Membland Hall.
The whole of the block presents very much the same picture as it must have done{9OO years ago}at the time of the {original Domesday survey}when it consisted of the Domesday Manor of Lambside Farm in the block, and part of the Domesday Manors of Battisborough and Membland whose centres are outside the block, except that the layout of the field pattern may have been different with much more rough grazing and rocky outcrops.
